trans-unit.source: Provides pop-up or online Help for controls.
Each instance of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider> maintains a collection of references to controls associated with it.
To associate a Help file with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider>, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.HelpNamespace%2A> property.

You specify the type of Help provided by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetHelpNavigator%2A> method and providing a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator> value for the specified control.
You provide the keyword or topic for the Help by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetHelpKeyword%2A> method.
To open Help to a specific topic, the keyword should be passed in the form *topicName*.htm.
To associate a specific Help string with a control, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetHelpString%2A> method.
The string that you associate with a control using this method is displayed in a pop-up window when the user presses the F1 key while the control has focus.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.HelpNamespace%2A> property has not been set, you must use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetHelpString%2A> method to provide the Help text.
If you have set both <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.HelpNamespace%2A> and the Help string, Help based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.HelpNamespace%2A> will take precedence.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider> calls methods on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help> class to provide Help functionality.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider"></xref> class.

Once you have created an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider> class, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.HelpNamespace%2A> property, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetHelpKeyword%2A> method, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetHelpNavigator%2A> method to associate your Help topics with a control.
Specifies whether this object can provide its extender properties to the specified object.
The object that the externder properties are provided to.
`true` if this object can provide its extender properties; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the Help keyword for the specified control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> from which to retrieve the Help topic.

The Help keyword associated with this control, or `null` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider"></xref> is currently configured to display the entire Help file or is configured to provide a Help string.
Returns the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator"></xref> setting for the specified control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> from which to retrieve the Help navigator.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator"></xref> setting for the specified control.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.AssociateIndex"></xref>.
Returns the contents of the pop-up Help window for the specified control.
To display this Help string at run time, the user presses the F1 key while the specified control has the input focus.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> from which to retrieve the Help string.
The Help string associated with this control.
The default is `null`.
Returns a value indicating whether the specified control's Help should be displayed.

When you use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetHelpKeyword%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetHelpString%2A> method to associate a keyword or prompt with a specified control, calling this method automatically returns `true`.
You can override this behavior by passing `false` to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetShowHelp%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> for which Help will be displayed.
`true` if Help will be displayed for the control; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value specifying the name of the Help file associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider"></xref> object.
The file name retrieved by this method identifies the file that provides Help support for all the controls for which this object provides Help.
This file name can designate either a compiled Help (.chm) file or a raw HTML file.
The name of the Help file.
This can be of the form C:\path\sample.chm or /folder/file.htm.
Removes the Help associated with the specified control.
This method is used by the designer.
The control to remove Help from.
Specifies the keyword used to retrieve Help when the user invokes Help for the specified control.
The Help keyword provides the key information to retrieve the Help associated with this control from the Help file specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.HelpNamespace%2A> property.
To open Help to a specific topic, the keyword should be passed in the form *topicName*.htm.
To clear the keyword, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetHelpKeyword%2A> method with a `keyword` value of `null`.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> that specifies the control for which to set the Help topic.
The Help keyword to associate with the control.
Specifies the Help command to use when retrieving Help from the Help file for the specified control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> for which to set the Help keyword.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator"></xref> values.
The value of navigator is not one of the values.
Specifies the Help string associated with the specified control.
The Help string that you specify in the `helpString` parameter is displayed in a pop-up window when the user presses the F1 key while the specified control has focus.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> with which to associate the Help string.
The Help string associated with the control.
Specifies whether Help is displayed for the specified control.

If you previously called the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetHelpString%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetHelpKeyword%2A> for the control specified in the `ctl` parameter, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider> automatically displays Help for that control.
To modify this behavior, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.SetShowHelp%2A> method, specifying `false` in the `value` parameter.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> for which Help is turned on or off.
`true` if Help displays for the control; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the object that contains supplemental data about the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains data about the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider"></xref>.
Returns a string that represents the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.ToString%2A> method returns a string that includes the type and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider.HelpNamespace%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider>.
A string that represents the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HelpProvider"></xref>.
